Develop your understanding of business analytics. You’ll graduate with the skills you need to start a career specialising in data and decision analysis.
This course is for graduates who want to pursue a career in business analytics.
How can companies use ‘big data’ to gain business insight? This course will teach you how to convert data into knowledge. Get hands-on practical experience using the latest business intelligence software and interpreting real data.
This course includes guest lectures from industry experts, and a unit co-delivered by a specialist from IBM.
In partnership with IBM, Qlik, WinPure and the Women in OR & Analytics Network.
We're ranked top 100 in the world and UK top 10 for our MSc in Business Analytics in the QS Business Masters rankings 2025.
We combine the latest research with many opportunities to apply it. This will help you stand out from the crowd. You'll develop key professional skills and work with our partner organisations on optional projects from day one. Find out more about optional activities.
Our graduates have a great employment record. Most go on to careers in a range of areas, start their own business or begin a PhD. Find out more about how we prepare you for career success.
81% of our 2022 and 2023 graduates had accepted a job offer within three months of completing their degree. View more graduate career data.
Our School of Management building opened in June 2022. The latest technology gives you a flexible and modern learning environment. The design focuses on working together, with an open layout to enable effective teamwork.
Our building encourages engagement with other students and academics. A dedicated Employability Hub provides a space for you to meet and network with our industry partners.
You’ll learn from staff with backgrounds and expertise in relevant areas of business analytics. This course has been designed to ensure the available units complement each other to meet its overall aims.
Before you apply for a course, please check the website for the most recently published course detail. If you apply to the University of Bath, you will be advised of any significant changes to the advertised programme, in accordance with our Terms and Conditions.
We understand that you will want to know more about the shape of the academic year. We work hard and plan for different scenarios, to be able to welcome you to the University of Bath at the start of each semester.
Occasionally we make changes to our programmes in response to, for example, feedback from students, developments in research and the field of studies, and the requirements of accrediting bodies. You will be advised of any significant changes to the advertised programme, in accordance with our Terms and Conditions.
These lists are to give you an idea of some, but not all, of the learning and assessment methods used on this course. They are not exhaustive lists and methods are subject to change.
Your overall workload consists of class contact hours, independent learning and assessment activities. The balance of these elements within your overall workload may vary depending on the units you choose.
Timetabled contact hours, which can be made up of lectures, seminars, tutorials and laboratory classes, vary throughout your course and between courses but are typically between 10 and 16 hours a week during the taught semesters.
Additional briefing sessions will be provided to help you prepare for the dissertation period and as part of the co-curricular offering of live projects. (See below for the co-curricular offering.) You will receive direct guidance from an allocated member of academic staff for your dissertation activity.
As well as timetabled contact hours, you're expected to undertake independent learning and assessment. Typically, this might be around 25 - 30 hours per week, and include individual research, reading journal articles and books, working on individual and group projects, preparing coursework, presentations, or revising for exams.
You will experience a broad balance between different forms of assessment: individual and group assignments, as well as examinations. The work required may include written submissions, live presentations and recorded videos. Assessment on the course has been designed to support your professional development in important business skills.
The final degree grade is determined by a weighted average of the taught semesters (two thirds) and the dissertation/practice activity (one third).
We can make reasonable adjustments to assessment procedures for students with disabilities. Take a look at our Disability Service’s pages for information.
As well as being recognised as a higher academic qualification, a number of our degrees are also accredited by professional bodies in the United Kingdom. An accredited degree may entitle you to work in a specific profession within the UK, and abroad (where there are reciprocating arrangements with professional bodies in other countries).
The requirements to practise a profession vary from country to country. If you wish to practise your profession outside the United Kingdom, you are advised to confirm that the UK professional qualification you seek is valid in the country in which you are intending to work.
2:1 or above (or its international equivalent). Your degree can be in any discipline but you must have studied a subject with high quantitative content.
You will be better suited to this course if you have studied business or management, or studied a subject with high quantitative content, such as:
If you are a UK student and completed your undergraduate degree abroad, your qualification must be equivalent to a 2:1 or above.
Previous experience of computer programming is an advantage. You should include information about your quantitative and programming experience in your personal statement.
In exceptional cases, relevant work experience may be a substitute for the degree requirement. You should have no more than three years’ relevant work experience.
You will need an International English Language Test System (IELTS) score of at least 7.0 overall. Your scores for reading, writing, listening and speaking must be at least 6.5.
These results must be no more than two years old from the start date of your MSc course.
Read more on the IELTS website.
We also accept other language tests, including PTE Academic, TOEFL. iBT, CPE and CAE.
Read more about alternative language tests.
If you have already taken a test but have not met the required standard, you can apply to take a pre-sessional course at the University. Find out more about pre-sessional courses.
If you completed all of your undergraduate studies in:
You may be exempt from our English language requirements.
If you have an overall IELTS score of 6.5 or 6.0 you may qualify for a combined offer.
An overall IELTS score of 6.5 may allow you to take a five-week English course before your MSc. Each of your listening, reading, writing and speaking scores must be at least 6.0.
An overall IELTS score of 6.0 may allow you to take a ten-week course before your MSc. Each of your listening, reading, writing and speaking scores must be at least 5.5.
Find out more about combined offers.
A Bachelor degree (Ptychio) with a final overall result of at least 6.5 out of 10.
Your degree can be in any discipline but you must have studied a subject with high quantitative content.
You will be better suited to this course if you have studied business or management, or studied a subject with high quantitative content, such as:
If you studied your undergraduate degree in the UK your qualification must be equivalent to a 2:1 or above.
A Baccalaureus or Candidatus/a with an overall final result of at least 7.25 on a 10-point scale.
A Bachelor degree (Honours) with a final overall result of Second Class (Division 1) Honours or 3.0 out of 4.0.
A Licenciado with a final overall result of at least 15 out of 20.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least 3.5 on a 5-point scale or 3.0 on a 4-point scale.
A strong Bachelor (Honours) degree when studied at Nanyang Technological University (NTU), National University of Singapore (NUS), Singapore Institute of Technology or Singapore University of Social Sciences with a final overall result of at least Second Class (Upper) Honours, or a strong Bachelor degree when studied at Singapore Management University (SMU) or Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD). Typically, we require a final overall result of at least Second Class (Upper) Honours, 60% or B, however we ask that you upload a copy of the grading scale used by your institution, along with your transcript, when you submit your application due to the range of grading scales used by different institutions.
A Bachelor degree (Haksa) with a final overall result of at least 3.0 out of 4.3 or 3.5 out of 4.5.
A Bachelor degree, Esrte Staatsprüfung (Primarstufe / Sekundarstufe I), Fachhochschuldiplom / Diplom (FH) or Magister Artium with a final overall result of at least 2.5 (Gut).
A Bachelor Degree (Baccalauréat Universitaire) with a final overall result of at least 5 out of 6.
A Kandidaatti / Kandidat (University Bachelor Degree), (Professional Title) (AMK/YH) (Bachelor degree from a University of Applied Sciences), Arkkitehti / Arktitekt / Diplomi-insööri / Diplomingenör / Proviisori / Provisor with a final overall result of at least 3.5 on a 5-point scale.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of Upper Second Class (60% or 3.25 on a 4-point scale).
You should have a Bachelor degree from a university with a final overall result of at least 75% (Very Good) or 3.0 on a 4-point scale.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least 75% depending on the institution attended.
A Bachelor degree (Sarjana I) with a final overall result of at least 3.0 out of 4.0.
A Bachelor's degree or Professional Doctorate with a final overall result of at least 14 out of 20 when studied at a state university and 15 out of 20 when studied at a private university.
A Honours Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least Second Class Honours (Grade I).
A University Bachelor degree (Ptychio) or Diploma with a final overall score of at least 6.5 out of 10.
A Laurea, Laurea in Ingegneria / Architettura, Diploma Accademico di Primo Livello, Diploma di Mediatore Linguistico or Licenza di Academia di Belle Arti with a final result of at least 102 out of 110.
A Bachelor degree or Fachhochschuldiplom/Diplom (FH) with a final result of at least Gut.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least Second Class Honours (Upper Division).
A Licencjat or Inżynier (Bachelor degree) with a final overall result of at least 4.5 on a 5-point scale.
A Diplomă de Licență (Bachelor degree), Diplomă de Inginer or Diplomă de Urbanist Diplomat with a final overall result of at least 8 out of 10.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least CGPA 3.0.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least Second Class (Division 1).
A four year Bachelor degree from a recognised university with a final overall result of at least 65% or 3.25/4.0 or Masters degree following a three year or four year Bachelor degree.
A Bachelorgrad (Bachelor degree), Candidatus/a Magisterii, Sivilingeniør or Siviløkonom with a final overall result of at least B.
A four-year Bachelor degree from a high ranked (HEC) university with a final overall result of at least a First Class (Division 1). CGPA of at least 3.0 and above depending on grading system.
A Bachelor degree (Bằng Tốt Nghiệp Đại Học/Bằng Cử Nhân) of at least four years or a Masters (Thạc sĩ) from a recognised degree-awarding institution with a final overall result of at least 7.0 on a 10-point scale.
A Kandidatexamen (Bachelor Degree) or Yrkesexamen (Professional Bachelor degree) with a final overall result of at least Grade B. Please contact us if your institution uses a different grading scale.
A Lisans Diplomasi (Bachelor degree) or Mühendis Diplomasi with a final overall score of at least GPA 2.8-3.0 on a 4-point scale, depending on the institution you have attended.
A Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least 3 out of 4, 80% or B.
A Bachelor degree (awarded after 2007) or Specialist Diploma with a final result of at least 80% or 3.5 on a 4-point scale. Please contact us if your institution uses a different grading scale.
A Bachelor Honours degree, Professional Bachelor degree or Baccalaureus Technologiae (Bachelor of Technology) with a final overall result of at least Second Class (Division One) or 70%.
A Título Universitario Oficial de Licenciado en (subject area) (Licenciatura),  Título Universitario Oficial de Graduado en (subject area) (Grado), Título de Ingeniero or Título de Arquitecto with a final overall result of at least 7 out of 10 (Notable/Very Good).
A Honors Bachelor degree or Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least CGPA 3.0 on a 4-point scale.
Typically, we require a Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least First Class. However, due to the number of different grading scales in use, we ask that you upload a copy of the grading scale used by your institution, along with your transcript, when you submit your application.
A four year Bachelor degree with a final overall score of at least 75-80% depending on the institution attended.
A Bachelor degree, Candidatus Philosophiae, Diplomingeniør (Engineer), Professionsbachelor (Professional Bachelor degree) or Korrespondenteksamen with a final overall result of at least 7 out of 10.
A Bachelor Honours degree with a final result of at least Second Class (Upper Division) or a Bachelor degree with a final result of Distinction or higher.
A Bakalavr (Bachelor degree) or Specialist Diploma with a final overall result of at least 4.5 on a 5-point scale or 3.2 on a 4-point scale.
A Título de Licenciado or Título (Profesional) de (subject area) with a final overall result of least 8 out of 10.
A Bachelor degree or Doctoraal with a final overall result of at least 7 out of 10.
We welcome applications from graduates from all countries. If you can’t see your country in the list, please contact our admissions team for advice about your specific entry requirements.
To apply for this course, you should have an undergraduate degree equivalent to a UK 2:1 or above. Your degree can be in any discipline but you must have studied a subject with high quantitative content, such as mathematics/statistics, computer science, engineering, physics or a quantitative social science.
We may make an offer based on a lower grade if you can provide evidence of your suitability for the course.
A Grade de licence / Grade de licence professionnelle with a final overall result of at least 13 out of 20.
A Bachelier, Licencié or Licentiaat and other two cycle diplomas with a final overall score of at least 16 out of 20.
A Bachelor degree (Gakushi) with a final overall result of at least 3.0 out of 4.0 (B).
A Titulo de Bacharel, Titulo de (subject area) or Licenciado/a with a final overall result of at least 7.5 out of 10.
A Bachelor degree (Honours) or Bachelor degree with a final overall result of at least CGPA 3.0 on a 4-point scale (B or 70%).  Please contact us if your institution uses a different grading scale.
A Bachelor degree/Licence or Maîtrise from a recognised institution with a final overall result of at least 80%, GPA 3.2 on a 4-point scale, or 13 out of 20.
You should have a Master's degree (following a 3 or 4 year Bachelor degree) with a final overall grade of at least 3.2 out of 4.0 (65% or B+).
Your tuition fees and how you pay them will depend on whether you are a Home or Overseas student.
See the most recent fees for postgraduate courses.
All School of Management MSc courses have a £60 application fee. Do not pay the fee until you have completed your application. You can pay the fee using the University’s online payment system.
If we offer you a place on a course, you will need to pay a £1,500 deposit to secure it.
If you are studying a postgraduate course, you may be able to take out a loan for your tuition fees and living costs.
A range of scholarships are available with varying award amounts, with over 50 scholarships available.
You can pay your tuition fees by Direct Debit, debit card, credit card or bank transfer. You may also be eligible for a student loan to help you pay your fees.
As well as the cost of books, you will also need to cover the cost of scanning and photocopying. You should budget at least £100 for this.
Some courses involve engagement away from the University campus, and you may be required to pay some or all of the costs for these optional events.
We recommend you apply early as we may close applications before the deadline if a course is full.
We may consider late applications but if you need a Student Visa to study in the UK, you will need time to apply for and receive your visa to be in the UK by the start of the course.
Explore advanced forecasting methods using R statistical  software. You'll learn how to:
Develop proficiency in advanced data visualisation techniques vital for the business world. Use flexible programming methods to craft impactful static and interactive graphs that effectively convey insights. Learn best practices, design principles, and techniques for visualising diverse data types like geospatial, network, time series, and textual content. Enhance your ability to analyse complex datasets and present compelling visual narratives to inform decision-making in the business context.
Learn from industry experts including a business analytics specialist from IBM. Using business case studies, you'll focus on business analytics software and its:
Get an introduction to data analysis using statistics and forecasting techniques. You'll learn how to get the best possible estimates for unknown parameters like customer demand.
Learn how to discover patterns (e.g. a retailer's customer profiles) in data using algorithms. You'll also learn how to apply machine learning methods to pattern recognition problems.
Learn computerised methods of storing data and presenting dashboard summaries. You'll develop your understanding of database reports and how to use them to present management information.
Complete a written research project. You'll:
Learn algorithm development and implementation for making optimised decisions, and solve a real world problem working in teams.  You'll use software to simulate business processes for what-if-analysis and risk assessment.
Develop an in-depth knowledge of operational strategy. You'll learn:
Get an introduction in how to use mathematics and computers to make the best possible decisions.  You'll learn about the advanced functions of Excel and the programming language (VBA) within it.
Learn techniques to help successfully manage projects.  You'll learn to:
• An MSc in Business Analytics gives you a range of career opportunities across different sectors
• Get practical experience in computer programming and the latest business analytics software
• Our small, carefully-selected class sizes allows for plenty of individual interaction with academics, career advisors and industry experts
• Graduate equipped with the skills global employers want. Big data's importance to businesses is growing, and our graduates are in high demand

pages.content:
[HEADING] Applying for a postgraduate loan
[HEADING] Find out if you're eligible for a postgraduate loan to help you study for a master's degree or PhD.
[HEADING] Loans for Home students
[HEADING] Living in England
[HEADING] Living in Northern Ireland
[HEADING] Living in Scotland
[HEADING] Living in Wales
[HEADING] Eligibility
[HEADING] Master's degree loans
[HEADING] Doctoral programme loans
[HEADING] On this page
If you have Home fee status and are starting your postgraduate course in 2025/26, you may be eligible to apply for a postgraduate loan from the UK government.
The loan you can apply for and the amount you can get depends on where you normally live and whether you're studying for a master's degree or PhD. Contact your relevant student loans awarding agency for more advice and support about loans you can apply for.
If you normally live in England you can apply for loans for postgraduate master’s courses and doctoral programmes.
If you are studying for a master's degree, you can borrow up to £12,858.
If you are studying for a PhD, you can borrow up to £30,301 if your course starts on or after 1 August 2025. You can borrow up to £29,390 if your course started between 1 August 2024 and 31 July 2025.
If you normally live in Northern Ireland, you can apply for a loan for postgraduate master's, postgraduate certificate and diploma level courses. You can't apply for a loan for doctoral study.
If you are studying for a master's degree, you can borrow up to £6,500.
If you normally live in Scotland, you can apply for a loan to study a postgraduate diploma or master’s course. You can't apply for a loan for doctoral study.
If you're studying for a master's degree, you can borrow up to £13,900.
If you normally live in Wales you can apply for loans for postgraduate master’s courses and doctoral programmes.
If you are studying for a master's degree, you can borrow up to £19,255.
If you are studying for a PhD, you can borrow up to £29,130 if your course starts between 1 August 2025 and 31 July 2026. You can borrow up to £28,655 if your course starts between 1 August 2024 and 31 July 2025.
You should check the eligibility requirements from your student loans awarding agency to make sure you are able to apply for a loan.
You might not be eligible to apply if you:
Please note, eligibility requirements may vary between schemes and you should contact your relevant student loans awarding agency for further information.
• already have a qualification higher than or equivalent to the one you're applying for
• are already getting payments for another course
• have received a postgraduate master's loan before
• are behind in your repayments for a previous student loan
• already have Research Council funding
• already have a social work bursary
• are eligible for an NHS bursary
• are already getting an Educational Psychology bursary and your course starts on or after 1 August 2020
• are already getting payments for another course
• have received a postgraduate doctoral loan before
• already have a doctoral degree or a qualification that’s equivalent or higher
• are receiving a doctorate by publication
• are behind in your repayments for a previous student loan
• Loans for Home students
• Eligibility
• Contact us

pages.content:
[HEADING] Pre-sessional courses at the University of Bath
[HEADING] If you have received an offer to study at Bath but you need to improve your English first, a Pre-sessional English (PSE) course will prepare you.
[HEADING] Available courses
[HEADING] Summer courses
[HEADING] Online courses for School of Management students
[HEADING] On this page
All of our Pre-sessional English (PSE) courses aim to improve your accuracy and fluency in English, focusing on building the language and skills you need to be successful in your studies.
The courses will prepare you for study on your main degree programme by:
We offer two types of pre-sessional course.
These courses are available to all students who have received an offer to study at Bath but need to improve their English first. There are both 5 and 10 week courses available, and they run in-person on our Bath campus throughout July and August each year.
Find out more about our summer Pre-sessional English courses.
We offer a 5 week Pre-sessional English course exclusively for students joining a School of Management degree programme in January 2026. This course runs online throughout November and December.
Find out more about the 5 week online Pre-sessional course.
How to apply for a Pre-sessional course
• increasing your confidence in using English in academic contexts across speaking, listening, reading and writing
• developing independent learning as well as teamworking skills to prepare you for seminars, group projects, and presentations
• providing you with opportunities to practice and develop your academic English skills so you can succeed in your programme of study and beyond
• Available courses
• Contact us

pages.content:
[HEADING] Learn today, lead tomorrow
[HEADING] A dedicated careers advisor
[HEADING] Customised career workshops
[HEADING] Support for international students
[HEADING] Support for entrepreneurs
[HEADING] Industry Insight events
Our career support will help you develop the confidence you need to feel prepared from the moment you step into the interview room.
The practical focus of our courses will give you the skills and knowledge employers are looking for. You’ll interact with businesses, discover graduate opportunities and learn what recruiters look for.
Britain’s top employers target Bath’s graduates.
Our aim is to get you ready for the next step of your professional journey. We have a dedicated careers team and offer career training for all our MSc students. 
          
          

Your career support includes:
A dedicated careers advisor
You’ll have access to a dedicated careers advisor who will support you through every step of your job search. Through regular personal meetings your advisor will:

identify your strengths and interests
help you make job applications
help you practise interviews and assessment centre activities
continue to support you after you graduate

Customised career workshops
Experienced career advisors and graduate recruiters deliver our workshops. This will give you insight into what employers are really looking for. They cover all aspects of the recruitment process. You’ll get help with:

CVs
cover letters
online applications
interviews and interview practice
assessment centres
support for aptitude tests including maths refresher courses
skills development

You’ll also improve your teamwork, presentation and networking skills. These are essential for success on your course, for making job applications and once you start work.
Support for international students
Our careers team provides support specifically for international students. This includes:
Support for your job search in the UK
We’ll provide you with information on getting your work permit sponsored, both on the new points-based Skilled Worker visa and the Graduate Visa (Post-study work visa). You’ll get up to date information on where to apply, and how to maximise your success
Support for your job search outside the UK

We have regular webinars with global employers to promote graduate opportunities. We also run Virtual Careers Fairs focused on different sectors and locations. Meet global employers and get prepared for your international job search
You’ll benefit from our network of nearly 23,000 supportive alumni working in over 130 countries worldwide

Support for entrepreneurs
Entrepreneurship is a key theme at Bath. Many University of Bath graduates go on to become entrepreneurs and business innovators.
Bath SETsquared supports student-led entrepreneurial activities. Find out more about the help SETsquared offer.

You’ll also have access to the University’s wider alumni network of over 120,000 graduates. We have more than 24 groups worldwide that help our alumni connect and keep climbing together.

[HEADING] Taught postgraduate scholarships, bursaries, and other funding
[HEADING] Find out about the scholarships, bursaries, and other funding available to master's students to help fund your studies at Bath.
This scholarship is open to applicants of all nationalities and is awarded for academic excellence.
Global Leaders Scholarships are worth £5,000 to help you fund your studies.
Find out about funding and scholarship opportunities for a full-time master's, including how to apply.
There are many scholarships available to full-time and Executive part-time MBA students worth up to £15,000.
Find scholarship opportunities we can offer to applicants from specific countries.
This scholarship aims to support Lebanese students in pursuing higher education supported by shipping and logistics company CMA CGM Group.
This scheme is available to academic staff in Palestinian universities to study a Masters at Bath.
This scholarship is open to graduates of nominated Hong Kong universities who hold an offer to study a master's course with us.
This scholarship is open to eligible offer-holders in the People’s Republic of China.
If you're intending to study the MA Contemporary European Studies (Euromasters) course, then you could apply for funding to support you.
This award is made to eligible overseas fee-paying offer-holders for the campus-based MSc Artificial Intelligence and MSc Advanced Machine Learning courses.
The MyWorld Scholarship at Bath aims to support home students from under-represented groups studying in the Department of Computer Science.
Find out about scholarships available for talented athletes to study and train at Bath.
What you could get when you apply for a loan to study for a postgraduate master's degree.
American students can apply for US government or private education loans to help towards funding their studies at the University of Bath.
If you are a Canadian citizen or national you can choose to fund your studies in different ways.
Bursaries available to Bath alumni on Master's courses starting in the academic year 2025-26
Gain advanced skills and experience needed to apply for competitive PhD programmes in the UK and overseas, and apply for a £10,000 bursary to support yourself.
If you are an asylum seeker living in the UK, you may be eligible for a scholarship to pay for your taught postgraduate fees and a bursary worth £20,780.
If you are a young adult carer you can find information here on additional support and financial assistance.
If you are applying for University and have refugee, asylum seeker, HP or DLR status, there is information about financial and other support here.
You may be eligible for a 10% reduction in postgraduate tuition fees if you're University of Bath Alumni.
If you are a University of Bath employee, you may be eligible for a 75% discount off your postgraduate tuition fees.
Use The Alternative Guide to Postgraduate Funding to find out about funding options offered by external bodies.
The team behind Postgrad.com is offering 5 bursaries, worth £2,000 each, to postgraduate students.
Terms and conditions for scholarships offered in the Faculty of Science, Faculty of Engineering and Design and Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences.
Taught postgraduate students offered a Bath Merit Scholarship should read these terms and conditions before accepting the award
Read the terms and conditions for the Online MSc Business Analytics Scholarships.

[HEADING] Tuition fees
[HEADING] Home, EU, and Overseas fees for courses and placements, including extra costs and payment methods.
The tuition fees you must pay if you are starting an undergraduate course in the 2025/26 academic year. There are separate fees for placement years.
The tuition fees you need to pay for the 2024/25 academic year if you started your course in 2024. You'll also find placement year fees and fees for 2025/26.
The tuition fees you need to pay for the 2024/25 academic year if you started your course in 2023. You can also find the fees you'll need to pay in 2025/26.

The tuition fees you need to pay this academic year if you start your course before the 2025/26 academic year.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Taught postgraduate study
[HEADING] Study for a master's degree and join our community of graduates and professionals at Bath.
Watch this video to find out what it’s like to study for a master’s degree at Bath. You can watch the video with English or Mandarin subtitles.
Request a download of our master's prospectus and learn about our courses starting in September 2025.
Request a download of our master's prospectus in Mandarin and learn about our courses starting in September 2025.
The Money Advice team offers practical advice on managing money, funding and sourcing additional income during drop-in sessions and appointments.
Find out about the scholarships, bursaries, and other funding available to master's students to help fund your studies at Bath.
What you could get when you apply for a loan to study for a postgraduate master's degree.
You may be eligible for a 10% reduction in postgraduate tuition fees if you're University of Bath Alumni.
If you are applying for University and have refugee, asylum seeker, HP or DLR status, there is information about financial and other support here.
Explore our taught postgraduate courses starting in 2025.
How to apply for our taught postgraduate courses and accept an offer.
If you apply for a master's, you need to write a personal statement or statement of purpose to show you're ready for the course. Find out what we look for.
How the University determines your fee status and how this affects the tuition fees you pay.
Home, EU and Overseas fees for courses and placements, with details of extra costs and payment methods.
You can get in touch with one of our official representatives in your country about studying at Bath.
Ranked 7th in the UK by the Guardian University Guide 2025
Ranked 8th best university in the UK in the Complete University Guide 2026
Ranked 8th in the UK by The Times and The Sunday Times Good University Guide 2025
Ranked in the top 150 universities in the world in the QS World University Rankings 2026
92% of our research is classed as world-leading or internationally excellent by the Research Excellence Framework 2021
Find out what it's like to study for a master's or doctoral degree at Bath at one of our online Postgraduate Open Days.
We run events throughout the year, so you have lots of opportunities to connect with us and get the information you need about postgraduate study at Bath.
Take a virtual tour of our campus, including the student accommodation buildings, teaching rooms, laboratories, and Sports Training Village.
Ask us your questions about courses and university life at Bath.
Get to know our master's courses, campus and students online.
Find out about our accommodation options for postgraduates, to help you choose where to live.
How and where to search for privately rented accommodation in Bath that’s right for you.
What you need to know before you apply for postgraduate student accommodation.
Whether you're studying for an undergraduate or postgraduate degree, you’ll be taught by leading academics in an environment of innovation and discovery.
How we'll provide your teaching and learning so you gain the skills, knowledge, and experience you’ll need for the next steps in your career.
Use our study spaces, labs, specialist facilities, and support services to work towards achieving your academic potential.
Our research is helping to change the world for the better. We work in partnership to help create a healthier, more sustainable and connected future for us all.
Vertically Integrated Projects (VIPs) are innovative research-based projects that enable students and staff to collaborate on long-term real-world issues.
Make yourself more employable with our careers support and guidance, as well as opportunities to gain experience and develop new skills while you study.
Depending on your choice of master's degree from Bath you could gain valuable real-world experience and make contacts for your career.
We offer information, advice and guidance to students and graduates. We also work with employers to connect them with our students and recent graduates.
We have a range of different employer events, skills development workshops, and careers fairs that Careers organises throughout the year.
At Bath, we'll support you to develop lifelong academic and employability skills to get the most out of your studies and secure the future you want.
We offer courses throughout the academic year to build your language skills, develop your intercultural competence, and maximise your career prospects.
Yu Shuang talks about studying in the UK as a Malaysian student and how MSc Applied Psychology and Economic Behaviour helped shape his career path in academia.
Thai graduate Piyamon talks about her experience studying for an MSc at Bath, and how the diverse community set her up for success in her career.
Sherifat tells us about her experience studying a master's in International Development with Economics as a Gold Scholar.
MSc Computer Science graduate, Jordan Koulouris, is a Software Engineer for Tripadvisor. Find out more about his role and his experience at Bath.
MSc graduate Michael shares how employability resources, networking opportunities and a diverse community at Bath helped to prepare him for his future career.
Niloufar studied for an MEng in Integrated Mechanical and Electrical Engineering with support from a Gold Scholarship.
Find out what it's like to live in Bath and the South West while you study for your degree.
Explore your interests and make friends at Bath. Join societies and sports clubs, take an art class, or become a volunteer or student representative.
All of our students have access to top-class sporting facilities on campus, offering a wealth of opportunities to exercise, compete and just have fun.
Whether you dance, act, sing, write, play, draw, or want to try something new, SU Arts can support you in all things creative.
The SU helps students get the most from their time at Bath.
You can get advice, support, and guidance on an academic and personal level throughout your studies at Bath.
We provide students with support and guidance, including counselling and mental health, disability support, money management and international student advice.
The Disability Service can provide advice and support for applicants and current students and information to staff.
If you are a young adult carer you can find information here on additional support and financial assistance.
Support and care, space and prayer in the heart of the Campus. All People, All Year, All Churches.
The International Support Service offers practical advice, information, and support to international students.
Careers can help you with your career plans as an international student.
The SU connects cultures through events, support and representation to improve your student experience and ensure you get the most out of your time at Bath.
Find out which visa type you need, how to apply, and how our Student Immigration Service can help you with your visa questions.
Discover what it's like to live and study at the University, from applying and funding your studies to joining our student community.
